A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is a departure from the Skywalker storyline and a commitment to the future. To those stuck in their ways this is a travesty. To those who believe in the mantra “Adapt or Die” it’s a needed change of pace. Mark Hammill is perhaps at his very best as a man who has to come to terms with his abject failure while still being believed to be a savior. To know he set a dark path in motion because he doubted his own resolve. It not trudging the same Luke out to vanquish evil and lead the pack. It’s different. It’s fresh. It’s welcome. And yes\, it opens up the world of Star Wars to a greater audience. Combine with that the diversity in the cast\, the lead hero being a heroine and Star Wars now appeals to a greater audience then its core fan base. It positions Star Wars to “Reach Out” and create it’s own path rather than let its past forever dominate its destiny.
